question: What do pierogi and ravioli have in common?
content: People worldwide love dumplings, or pockets of dough stuffed with a filling. But different countries have their own ways of making them. For example, pierogi are a type of dumpling from Poland, while ravioli come from Italy. Ravioli are often stuffed with cheese and herbs. Pierogi, on the other hand, are commonly stuffed with mashed potatoes. They are also usually larger than most ravioli. No matter the size or what's inside, dumplings of all kinds are delicious!

question: What do both peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and tortas have in common?
content: People love sandwiches everywhere, but different countries make them in different ways. For example, in the United States, people often eat peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. These are made with peanut butter and sweet jelly spread between two slices of bread. In Mexico, people enjoy tortas, a type of sandwich made with soft bread and filled with meats, cheese, and vegetables. While both are sandwiches, tortas are usually bigger and have more fillings than peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. No matter how they’re made, sandwiches are a tasty treat worldwide!

Scientists invented telescopes and microscopes to look at things they can't see with their eyes. A telescope is used to look at distant objects. On the other hand, a microscope helps people see extremely small things. Telescopes and microscopes work in a similar way. They use curved pieces of glass to make things look larger than they are. They allow people to see small details in the faraway or tiny objects they are viewing.
